results.title: 5 colours of France = 5 couleurs de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. Bouquinistes on the River Seine. 2. Castillo - showing of his 1967-68 fashion designs. 3. Exhibition of “old time” posters from 1900 - art by Toulous le Trec is a part of this collection. 4. Behind the scenes look at Jean Luc Godard at work on his new film “Weekend”. 5. “Phoenetic Art” is on exhibition with the theme of “Light and Movement” at the Paris Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: 4000 frames
results.brief_description: An ‘eye opener’ film experiment, this is a single frame film where every frame is discontinuous with the preceding frame. An attempt was made to avoid any type of relationship between frames whether of images, shapes and forms or association of ideas. The film sets out to investigate the way in which we can ‘read’ the content of single frames, when the frames are presented under varying conditions. Some of the images have been carefully composed, while others filmed simply as found objects.

results.brief_description: A study of fitness classes for women and girls, focusing on less strenuous exercises which range from skipping, medicine ball to ‘swing’ exercises.

results.title: 3rd Ave El = Third Avenue El
results.brief_description: A dizzying, poetic ride through the city on an elevated railway that today exists only in memory. The El was noisy, ponderous and rickety - a leftover from earlier times, but by exploring the train, its passengers, movements, colours and images we find that it had its own unique beauty.

results.title: 34 years after Hitler
results.creator_credit: William K McClure and CBS News
results.brief_description: Looks at neo-Nazi groups in Germany today that have been known to destroy Jewish cemeteries, paint swastikas on the street and distribute anti-Semitic propaganda. While not viewed as a flourishing movement on the verge of popular acceptance, the neo-Nazis are shown to be a group whose philosophy and immediate predecessors demand that their activities be put into proper perspective.

results.title: 330 million gods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Long Search”.
Ronald Eyre begins his search for the answers to the great philosophical questions of experience in India, home of 330 million gods. He discovers that Hinduism is really a philosophy of life rather than a religion. He visits Benares and a small village to discover what religion means to the ordinary people of India as they perform their daily rituals and celebrate festivals associated with their local deity. Much of the discussion hinges on the meaning of symbols, ritual and what is a God.

results.title: 3,900 million and one
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mayer, Oxfam and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World around us”.
Examines the way of life of a farming family living in the south of India. Provides an insight into the benefits and problems associated with the extended family system in rural India.
